problems.solution: Chain the implications: Modus Ponens to get "Q", then "R ∧ S", extract "R" via Simplification, then Modus Ponens to get "T".
Apply De Morgan's to get "¬P ∧ ¬Q", extract "¬P", extract "S" from "R ∧ S", then combine with Conjunction.
Apply Disjunctive Syllogism twice: get "Q ∧ R" and "T", then extract "Q" and combine with "T" via Conjunction.
Combine "P" and "Q" via Conjunction, apply Modus Ponens to get "R ∨ S", then Disjunctive Syllogism with "¬R" to get "S".
Apply Double Negation twice to get "P → Q" and "P", then chain Modus Ponens to get "R ∧ S", finally extract "R".
Get "Q" via Disjunctive Syllogism, then chain Modus Ponens through "R", "S", to "T".
Apply Hypothetical Syllogism to chain "P → Q" and "Q → R" to get "P → R", then use Modus Tollens with "¬R" to get "¬P".
Extract "P ∨ Q" and "R ∨ S" via Simplification, then apply Disjunctive Syllogism twice to get "Q" and "S", combine via Conjunction.
Apply Modus Ponens to get "Q → R", then Modus Ponens with "Q" to get "R", finally Modus Ponens with "R → S" to get "S".
Apply Simplification to separate conjuncts, then De Morgan's on each to get "¬P ∧ ¬Q" and "¬R ∧ ¬S", extract "¬P" and "¬R", combine via Conjunction.
Apply Destructive Dilemma (DN) with premises "(P → Q) ∧ (R → S)" and "¬Q ∨ ¬S" to directly conclude "¬P ∨ ¬R".
Expand "P ⊕ Q" to "(P ∨ Q) ∧ ¬(P ∧ Q)", extract "P ∨ Q", then use case analysis: both P and Q lead to R, so R must be true.
Apply Contrapositive (CONV) to "¬Q → ¬R" to get "R → Q", then apply Modus Ponens with "R" to get "Q".
Apply Resolution on "P ∨ Q" and "¬P ∨ R" to get "Q ∨ R", then Resolution with "¬Q ∨ S" to get "R ∨ S".
Use Distributivity or extract components: get "P" and "Q ∨ R", apply Disjunctive Syllogism to get "R", Modus Ponens to get "S", then Conjunction.
Apply Disjunctive Syllogism to get "Q ∧ R", then Simplification twice to extract "Q" and "R", apply Modus Ponens on each to get "S" and "T", finally Conjunction to combine them.
Apply Hypothetical Syllogism twice to chain the implications: "P → Q" and "Q → R" gives "P → R", then "P → R" and "R → S" gives "P → S". Finally, apply Modus Tollens with "¬S" to get "¬P".
Use Addition to get "P ∨ Q" from "P", apply Modus Ponens to get "R", then Modus Ponens again to get "S ∧ T", extract "S".
Expand "P ⊕ Q" to "(P ∨ Q) ∧ ¬(P ∧ Q)", use "¬P" with Disjunctive Syllogism to get "Q", then Conjunction with "¬P".

natural_language_premises: If the recipe includes eggs (P), then the cake is moist (Q).
If the cake is moist (Q), then it tastes rich (R).
If it tastes rich (R), then guests request it again (S).
If guests request it again (S), then sales increase (T).
The recipe includes eggs (P).
The bakery opens at 6 AM (U).
problems.description: Long chain of implications through four steps
problems.solution: Translate: P = 'Recipe includes eggs', Q = 'Cake is moist', R = 'Tastes rich', S = 'Guests request again', T = 'Sales increase', U = 'Opens at 6 AM'. Build chain P → T using Hypothetical Syllogism three times, then apply Modus Ponens with P to conclude T.
interpretation_hints: Chain four implications together step by step
Each conclusion becomes the condition for the next
U is irrelevant to reaching the conclusion

natural_language_premises: If the alarm fails (P), then the system is not secure (Q).
If the system is not secure (Q), then hackers can enter (R).
If hackers can enter (R), then data is compromised (S) and backups must be restored (T).
The alarm fails (P).
The server is in the cloud (U).
System upgrades are pending (V).
problems.description: Complex chain with compound consequence extraction
problems.solution: Translate: P = 'Alarm fails', Q = 'Not secure', R = 'Hackers enter', S = 'Data compromised', T = 'Restore backups', U = 'Cloud server', V = 'Upgrades pending'. Chain P → Q → R, apply Modus Ponens to get S ∧ T, extract T using Simplification.

variable_definitions.U: the server is in the cloud

interpretation_hints: Follow the chain carefully through multiple steps
Extract the needed component from compound consequent
Multiple irrelevant facts are provided

natural_language_premises: Either the investigation finds evidence (P) or the case is dismissed (Q).
If the investigation finds evidence (P), then charges are filed (R).
If charges are filed (R), then a trial is scheduled (S).
If a trial is scheduled (S), then justice is served (T).
The case is not dismissed (¬Q).
The defendant has legal representation (U).
The courtroom is available (V).
problems.solution: Translate: P = 'Find evidence', Q = 'Dismiss case', R = 'File charges', S = 'Schedule trial', T = 'Justice served', U = 'Legal representation', V = 'Courtroom available'. From P ∨ Q and ¬Q, deduce P. Chain P → R → S → T using Hypothetical Syllogism to build P → T, then apply Modus Ponens to conclude T.
interpretation_hints: Determine which option is true from the disjunction
Build the complete chain through three steps
Multiple facts are irrelevant

natural_language_premises: If the proposal is accepted (P), then both funding is allocated (Q) and the team is hired (R).
If funding is allocated (Q), then equipment is purchased (S).
If the team is hired (R), then training begins (T).
If equipment is purchased (S), then setup is completed (U).
If setup is completed (U), then the project launches (V).
The proposal is accepted (P).
problems.solution: Translate: P = 'Proposal accepted', Q = 'Funding allocated', R = 'Team hired', S = 'Equipment purchased', T = 'Training', U = 'Setup completed', V = 'Project launches'. Apply Modus Ponens to P → (Q ∧ R) to get Q ∧ R. Extract Q, apply Modus Ponens to Q → S to get S. Chain S → U → V using Hypothetical Syllogism, then apply Modus Ponens to get V.
interpretation_hints: Extract one component from compound consequent
Follow that single path to the conclusion
Other paths are irrelevant

natural_language_premises: If the chemical reaction occurs (P), then heat is generated (Q).
If heat is generated (Q), then the container expands (R).
If the container expands (R), then pressure increases (S).
If pressure increases (S), then a valve opens (T).
If a valve opens (T), then gas is released (U).
The chemical reaction does occur (P).
The lab is evacuated (V).
problems.solution: Translate: P = 'Reaction occurs', Q = 'Heat generated', R = 'Container expands', S = 'Pressure increases', T = 'Valve opens', U = 'Gas released', V = 'Lab evacuated'. Chain all five conditionals using Hypothetical Syllogism four times to get P → U, then apply Modus Ponens with P to conclude U.
interpretation_hints: Build the entire chain through five implications
Each step depends on the previous
One fact is not needed

natural_language_premises: Either the manager approves the transfer (P) or the employee stays (Q).
If the manager approves the transfer (P), then the employee relocates (R).
If the employee relocates (R), then both the position is filled (S) and new hire training occurs (T).
If the position is filled (S), then productivity increases (U).
The manager approves the transfer (P).
The company headquarters is in another state (V).
problems.description: Disjunctive option with compound intermediate result
problems.solution: Translate: P = 'Manager approves', Q = 'Employee stays', R = 'Employee relocates', S = 'Position filled', T = 'Training occurs', U = 'Productivity increases', V = 'HQ elsewhere'. From P ∨ Q and P being true, follow P → R to get R. Apply Modus Ponens to R → (S ∧ T) to get S ∧ T. Extract S, apply Modus Ponens to S → U to get U.

variable_definitions.V: the company headquarters is in another state

interpretation_hints: Follow one branch of the disjunction
Handle compound consequences properly
Extract only needed components

natural_language_premises: If the virus is detected (P), then antivirus software runs (Q).
If antivirus software runs (Q), then suspicious files are quarantined (R).
If suspicious files are quarantined (R), then both the system is cleaned (S) and backup is restored (T).
If the system is cleaned (S), then normal operations resume (U).
The virus is detected (P).
The IT team is on-call (V).
problems.solution: Translate: P = 'Virus detected', Q = 'Antivirus runs', R = 'Files quarantined', S = 'System cleaned', T = 'Backup restored', U = 'Operations resume', V = 'IT on-call'. Chain P → Q → R using Hypothetical Syllogism to get P → R. Apply Modus Ponens to get R. Apply Modus Ponens to R → (S ∧ T) to get S ∧ T. Extract S, apply Modus Ponens to S → U to get U.
interpretation_hints: Chain implications efficiently
Handle compound results correctly
Multiple irrelevant premises provided

natural_language_premises: Either the performance is excellent (P) or adequate (Q), but not both.
If the performance is excellent (P), then a promotion is offered (R).
If a promotion is offered (R), then both salary increases (S) and responsibilities expand (T).
If responsibilities expand (T), then the employee needs training (U).
The performance is excellent (P).
The budget includes raises (V).
problems.solution: Translate: P = 'Excellent performance', Q = 'Adequate performance', R = 'Promotion offered', S = 'Salary increases', T = 'Responsibilities expand', U = 'Needs training', V = 'Budget includes raises'. From P being true and P ⊕ Q, we confirm the path. Apply Modus Ponens through P → R → (S ∧ T) to get S ∧ T. Extract T, apply Modus Ponens to T → U to get U.
interpretation_hints: Use XOR to confirm the chosen path
Extract the needed component from compound result
Follow through to the final conclusion

natural_language_premises: If the student studies consistently (P), then they understand the material (Q).
If they understand the material (Q), then both they pass the exam (R) and feel confident (S).
If they pass the exam (R), then they earn college credit (T).
If they earn college credit (T), then they graduate on time (U).
If they graduate on time (U), then they enter the job market sooner (V).
The student studies consistently (P).
problems.natural_language_conclusion: They enter the job market sooner (V).
problems.description: Complex chain with compound intermediate step
problems.solution: Translate: P = 'Studies consistently', Q = 'Understands material', R = 'Passes exam', S = 'Feels confident', T = 'Earns credit', U = 'Graduates on time', V = 'Enters job market'. Apply Modus Ponens to P → Q to get Q. Apply Modus Ponens to Q → (R ∧ S) to get R ∧ S. Extract R, then chain R → T → U → V using Hypothetical Syllogism to get R → V. Apply Modus Ponens to conclude V.

variable_definitions.V: they enter the job market sooner

interpretation_hints: Navigate through compound intermediate results
Extract the needed component to continue the chain
Build a complete logical path
